data.title: Queens of the Stone Age
data.meta_description: Queens of the Stone Age artist page: interviews, features and/or performances archived at NPR Music
data.text:
Queens of the Stone Age digs into dark days on 'In Times New Roman...'

WXPN

Queens of the Stone Age frontman Josh Homme talks about striving for originality and vulnerability on the band's eight studio album, 'In Times New Roman...'.

Queens of the Stone Age on World Cafe

49:48

Artists We Love Cover Songs They Love

This week's new mix from All Songs Considered is all cover tunes, featuring musicians we love paying tribute to artists they love.

Artists We Love Cover Songs They Love

Listen · 54:54 54:54

Review

Music Reviews

Josh Homme's Rotating Supergroup The Desert Sessions Returns For 'Vols. 11 & 12'

Musicians on the Queens of the Stone Age frontman-led album include ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons and Primus' Les Claypool.

Josh Homme's Rotating Supergroup The Desert Sessions Returns For 'Vols. 11 & 12'

Listen · 3:55 3:55

Amplified And Orbital: Queens Of The Stone Age's Josh Homme On Living In The Moment

The band's frontman and founder talks to Kelly McEvers about being "a now-ist," working with Mark Ronson and Iggy Pop and the dancey sound on the band's new record, Villains.

Amplified And Orbital: Queens Of The Stone Age's Josh Homme On Living In The Moment

Listen · 7:59 7:59

Queens Of The Stone Age Release New Song, 'The Way You Used To Do'

The first single from Villains features a bouncing blues riff honkin' heavy on The Rolling Stones with Homme's unmistakable croon.

All Songs +1: Iggy Pop & Josh Homme Talk 'Post Pop Depression'

The pair behind Iggy Pop's latest album talks about theories of songwriting, formative musical experiences and why the perspective of a 68-year-old punk is essential to American music.

All Songs +1: Iggy Pop & Josh Homme Talk 'Post Pop Depression'

36:28

Review: Iggy Pop, 'Post Pop Depression'

The rock legend's new album with Queens Of The Stone Age's Josh Homme is all sharp angles, hard muscles and decadent ecstasy.

Poll Results: Listeners Pick Their Favorite Albums of 2013

See what albums NPR listeners picked in our year-end poll for the best music of 2013.

Poll Results: Listeners Pick Their Favorite Albums of 2013

Listen · 2:12:43 2:12:43

KCRW Presents: Queens Of The Stone Age

KCRW

Josh Homme, Troy Van Leeuwen, Dean Fertita, Michael Shuman and Jon Theodore make up one of the tightest live bands on the planet. Watch Queens Of The Stone Age perform "Keep Your Eyes Peeled" live.

Queens Of The Stone Age, Live In Concert

QOTSA performed ...Like Clockwork in its entirety, plus an assortment of older material, in a sold-out show at The Wiltern in Los Angeles. Hear highlights from the evening.

Queens Of The Stone Age, Live In Concert

6:28

New Mix: The Ghost Of A Saber Tooth Tiger, Sarah Blasko

On this episode of All Songs Considered, Queens of the Stone Age, Sean Lennon's new project, Sarah Blasko and the distinctive voices of Isobel Campbell and Mark Lanegan.

New Mix: The Ghost Of A Saber Tooth Tiger, Sarah Blasko

Listen · 26:22 26:22

The Dead Weather In Concert

The 9:30 Club in Washington, D.C., was ground zero for a blistering assault of explosive riff-rock, courtesy of The Dead Weather, in a full concert webcast live on NPR Music.

The Dead Weather In Concert

Listen · 1:02:19 1:02:19
